Own Sales</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Season</Name><Value>14 Autumn</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>VAT code for Accounts</Name><Value>VAT 3 (Exempt)</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Venue</Name><Value>New Wolsey Theatre, Civic Drive, Ipswich, IP1 2AS</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Youth Theatre</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Confirmation Text</Name><Value/></Attribute><Description>By / Ernest Hemingway &#xD;
An adaptation by / imitating the dog &#xD;
&#xD;
Acclaimed theatre makers imitating the dog bring their unique theatrical vision to this adaptation of A Farewell To Arms, one of the great love stories of the twentieth century. &#xD;
&#xD;
In war-torn Italy, 1918, ambulance driver Frederic Henry begins a relationship with nurse Catherine Barkley, discovering the redemptive power of love whilst experiencing a loss of innocence in a time of devastating conflict. This new adaptation will fuse video projection, stage design and original music to create an extraordinary version of Hemingway’s powerful meditation on love and the brutality of modern warfare.&#xD;
&#xD;
"multi-platform theatre makers of rare ambition" - The Guardian&#xD;
&#xD;
Autumn 4 or 8 Show Evening Package&#xD;
&#xD;
Book 4 or more shows in the same band and save up to £50&#xD;
Book 8 or more shows in the same band and save up to £100&#xD;
&#xD;
Book all your tickets in the same price band (Premium or Band A) for your choice of Midsummer Songs, Private Peaceful, The Trials Of Oscar Wilde, Champions Of Magic, The Kings Of Cool, Eric And Little Ern, Songbird: The Music Of Eva Cassidy, Mugenkyo Taiko Drummers, Three Men In A Boat, The Magnificent Music Hall, Mud Morganfield, A Farewell To Arms and This Is My Family. The discount will automatically be applied. For further details visit www.wolseytheatre.co.uk/eveningpackages</Description><Duration>0</Duration><HtmlDescription>&lt;div id&gt;&#xD;

Adapted by / V A Pearn &#xD;
Directed by / Joe Leat and Rob Salmon&#xD;
&#xD;
‘Come with us, friends, whatever be your ages, and meet some folk from out the magic pages!’&#xD;
&#xD;
On an ordinary summer’s afternoon, Alice tumbles down a rabbit hole and an extraordinary adventure begins. In a strange world with even stranger characters, she meets a grinning cat, joins a mad tea party and plays croquet with the Queen! Lost in this fantasy land, Alice finds herself growing more and more curious by the minute…&#xD;
&#xD;
Join the New Wolsey Youth Theatre for a trip through Lewis Carroll’s world of magic and wonder where nothing is ever as it seems. &#xD;
&#xD;
Suitable for ages 7 and up.</Description><Duration>0</Duration><HtmlDescription>&lt;div id&gt;&#xD;
	&lt;h1&gt;Alice's Adventures In Wonderland&lt;/h1&gt;&#xD;
&lt;/div&gt;</HtmlDescription><ImageUrl>f6d4600e-ddcf-40bc-8b12-22ced08f5a2d.jpg</ImageUrl><IsOnSale>true</IsOnSale><Name>Alice's Adventures In Wonderland</Name><RelatedEvents><Event id="19082"/></RelatedEvents><RelatedStockItems/><ThumbnailUrl>4776a003-7f5e-408d-82e5-368293680f2a.jpg</ThumbnailUrl></Event><Event id="18675"><Attribute><Name>Account Code</Name><Value>41011 - J64</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Children</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Comedy</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Dance</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Different</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Drama</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Family</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Food</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Friends</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Music</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Musical</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>New Wolsey Production</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>New Writing</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Open Season</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Opera</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Other Venues</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Panto</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Poetry</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Pulse Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Sales Type</Name><Value>NWT - Own Sales</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Season</Name><Value>14 Autumn</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>VAT code for Accounts</Name><Value>VAT 3 (Exempt)</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Venue</Name><Value>New Wolsey Theatre, Civic Drive, Ipswich, IP1 2AS</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Youth Theatre</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>EventInfo</Name><Value/></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Confirmation Text</Name><Value/></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Felixstowe Book Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Description>Following a sell-out performance of In My Shoes in 2013, hip hop dance company Rationale are back, and they want your feedback.&#xD;
&#xD;
Rationale will return to Ipswich and the New Wolsey Theatre for 3 days where they will be exploring new storytelling techniques that will immerse you in an innovative way of interacting with dance, giving you ownership of the show. &#xD;
&#xD;
An Audience with Rationale is all about questioning the pre-conceptions of theatre, breaking down the barriers, and enveloping the audience in something new and sensational. On Sat 11 October, you can see what they have produced and tell them what you think.&#xD;
&#xD;
Exciting plans are already in place to talk to artists and the community to inform the theatre making process. </Description><Duration>0</Duration><HtmlDescription>&lt;div id&gt;&#xD;

	&lt;h1&gt;BBQ Night&lt;/h1&gt;&#xD;
&lt;/div&gt;</HtmlDescription><ImageUrl>ef4b630f-e165-49db-8382-d3cadbcf8dc8.jpg</ImageUrl><IsOnSale>true</IsOnSale><Name>BBQ Night</Name><RelatedEvents/><RelatedStockItems/><ThumbnailUrl>f5d72eb0-8f97-469e-ac66-eb434c19e709.jpg</ThumbnailUrl></Event><Event id="17678"><Attribute><Name>Account Code</Name><Value>41011 - K40</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Comedy</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Confirmation Text</Name><Value>REMEMBER! This event is NOT at the main theatre. If you need additional directions, please contact a Ticket Sales Assistant on 01473 295900.  </Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Dance</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Different</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Drama</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>EventInfo</Name><Value>Presented by Toot</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Family</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Felixstowe Book Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Food</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Friends</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Music</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Musical</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Open Season</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Opera</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Panto</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Poetry</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Pulse Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Sales Type</Name><Value>NWT - Own Sales</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Season</Name><Value>14 Autumn</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>VAT code for Accounts</Name><Value>VAT 3 (Exempt)</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Venue</Name><Value>HEG High Street Exhibition Gallery, High Street, Ipswich, IP1 3QH</Value></Attribute><Description>An irreverently comic yet tender look at how music seeps into and influences our lives.&#xD;
&#xD;
TOOT will immerse you in a world of CDs, cassettes and videotapes; rewinding, fast-forwarding and pausing fantasies, memories, the rawness of love and the music that defines it. Hit repeat and relive together the scenes you play over and over in your head, the moments you can't change - all set to a soundtrack of ‘90s classics.&#xD;
&#xD;
Created and performed by Stuart Barter, Clare Dunn &amp; Terry O’Donovan with a soundtrack of original (and some not-so-original) tunes.&#xD;
&#xD;
Contains strong language.&#xD;
&#xD;
Produced by Faith Dodkins.&#xD;
An Ovalhouse seed commission. Supported by Shoreditch Town Hall, Cambridge Junction &amp; Escalator Performing Arts. </Description><Duration>70</Duration><HtmlDescription>&lt;div id&gt;&#xD;
	&lt;h1&gt;Be Here Now&lt;/h1&gt;&#xD;
&lt;/div&gt;</HtmlDescription><ImageUrl>2a3d4bde-10e4-4270-8d3a-7706c2639c21.jpg</ImageUrl><IsOnSale>true</IsOnSale><Name>Be Here Now</Name><RelatedEvents/><RelatedStockItems/><ThumbnailUrl>41d51cf0-6c5c-4de4-be32-72786ad4d8e5.jpg</ThumbnailUrl></Event><Event id="14071"><Attribute><Name>Account Code</Name><Value>41011-205</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Comedy</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Dance</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Different</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Drama</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>EventInfo</Name><Value>The Rock and Roll Panto</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Family</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Felixstowe Book Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Food</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Friends</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Music</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Musical</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>New Wolsey Production</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Open Season</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Opera</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Other Venues</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Panto</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Poetry</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Pulse Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Sales Type</Name><Value>NWT - Own Sales</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Season</Name><Value>14 Autumn</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>VAT code for Accounts</Name><Value>VAT 3 (Exempt)</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Venue</Name><Value>New Wolsey Theatre, Civic Drive, Ipswich, IP1 2AS</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Youth Theatre</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Confirmation Text</Name><Value/></Attribute><Description>Presented by The New Wolsey Theatre.&#xD;
&#xD;
It’s time to Get This Party Started as Prince Promising is about to be crowned his country's rightful King – there’s only one tiny problem, he needs to find his Beauty. After a Wicked Witch transforms the handsome Prince into a hideous Beast, he needs to Keep On Runnin’ until he finds Somebody To Love.&#xD;
 &#xD;
Meanwhile Beauty, who is under the thumb of her two sisters down on Dame Bessie's Suffolk farm, is keen to prove You Can’t Hurry Love. After saving her father from the clutches of the mysterious creature that lives in the castle, will she ever end up Dancing In The Moonlight?&#xD;
 &#xD;
Join Fairy Fortunate and Company as they bring you Beauty and the Beast – transformed into one of the New Wolsey Theatre’s irresistible rock ‘n’ roll pantomimes! A beautiful traditional story married to some monster rock, pop and soul songs all served up by our brilliant company of actor- musicians - Let Us Entertain You!&#xD;
&#xD;
For children aged 2 to 6 you might want to check out our studio Christmas production Dogs Don't Do Ballet which is the perfect alternative for our younger audience!</Description><Duration>150</Duration><HtmlDescription>&lt;div id&gt;&#xD;

	&lt;h1&gt;Emily Brown And The Thing&lt;/h1&gt;&#xD;
&lt;/div&gt;</HtmlDescription><ImageUrl>f6cbed63-c726-4f78-b349-096aca298428.jpg</ImageUrl><IsOnSale>true</IsOnSale><Name>Emily Brown And The Thing</Name><RelatedEvents/><RelatedStockItems/><ThumbnailUrl>f2bbee9e-e130-450a-9f89-a5f4d12d10fd.jpg</ThumbnailUrl></Event><Event id="18676"><Attribute><Name>Account Code</Name><Value>41011 - J66</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Children</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Comedy</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Dance</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Different</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Drama</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>EventInfo</Name><Value>Olivier Award Nominee 2014</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Family</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Felixstowe Book Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Food</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Friends</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Music</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Musical</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>New Wolsey Production</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>New Writing</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Open Season</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Opera</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Other Venues</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Panto</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Poetry</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Pulse Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Sales Type</Name><Value>NWT - Own Sales</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Season</Name><Value>14 Autumn</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>VAT code for Accounts</Name><Value>VAT 3 (Exempt)</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Venue</Name><Value>New Wolsey Theatre, Civic Drive, Ipswich, IP1 2AS</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Youth Theatre</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Confirmation Text</Name><Value/></Attribute><Description>Created and performed by / Ian Ashpitel and Jonty Stephens &#xD;
Featuring classic material by / Eddie Braben, Dick Hills and Sid Green &#xD;
&#xD;
This affectionate, moving and fantastically funny homage to the greatest comedy double act that Britain has ever seen vividly brings back warm memories of a bygone era. Recreating some of the finest moments of Eric and Ernie’s television and stage performances, cherished moments from the archives sit alongside new material created by the performers. Together they make a brilliant comedy that recreates the all-ages appeal of Morecambe and Wise in their heyday. &#xD;
&#xD;
‘Ashpitel and Stephens have got the duo’s mannerisms down pat to such a winning extent... you could watch this for hours.’ - **** Daily Telegraph&#xD;
&#xD;
Autumn 4 or 8 Show Evening Package&#xD;
&#xD;
Book 4 or more shows in the same band and save up to £50&#xD;
Book 8 or more shows in the same band and save up to £100&#xD;
&#xD;

The discount will automatically be applied. For further details visit www.wolseytheatre.co.uk/eveningpackages</Description><Duration>105</Duration><HtmlDescription>&lt;div id&gt;&#xD;
	&lt;h1&gt;Eric And Little Ern&lt;/h1&gt;&#xD;
&lt;/div&gt;</HtmlDescription><ImageUrl>8c7c7962-eba1-4a6f-8175-32c6c1b46529.jpg</ImageUrl><IsOnSale>true</IsOnSale><Name>Eric And Little Ern</Name><RelatedEvents><Event id="19675"/></RelatedEvents><RelatedStockItems/><ThumbnailUrl>cdd75c5e-d10e-494e-8ff2-685a016dcd7b.jpg</ThumbnailUrl></Event><Event id="19477"><Attribute><Name>Account Code</Name><Value>41011 J80 </Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Comedy</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Dance</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Different</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Drama</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>EventInfo</Name><Value>Meet at Ticket Desk</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Family</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Felixstowe Book Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Food</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Friends</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Music</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Musical</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Open Season</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Opera</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Panto</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Poetry</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Pulse Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Sales Type</Name><Value>NWT - Own Sales</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Season</Name><Value>14 Autumn</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>VAT code for Accounts</Name><Value>VAT 3 (Exempt)</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Venue</Name><Value>New Wolsey Theatre, Civic Drive, Ipswich, IP1 2AS</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Confirmation Text</Name><Value/></Attribute><Description>The Trial of Benjamin Hart.&#xD;
&#xD;
A talk presented by Dr John Greenacre, First World War Centenary Project Coordinator from University Campus Suffolk&#xD;
&#xD;
Private Benjamin Hart of the Suffolk Regiment was a Territorial soldier from Ipswich. Having lived and fought for months on the Western Front Private Hart was arrested and tried for desertion. John Greenacre examines the trial and verdict of Benjamin Hart and wider aspects of British military justice during the First World War.&#xD;
&#xD;
This season, the New Wolsey Theatre will be taking part in a global commemoration to remember the lives of those who lived, fought and died in the First World War. &#xD;
&#xD;
IWM (Imperial War Museums) are leading the First World War Centenary Partnership, a network of cultural and educational organisations, and these events will be listed along with many others across the country.&#xD;
&#xD;
Find out more at www.1914.org</Description><Duration>0</Duration><HtmlDescription>&lt;div id&gt;&#xD;
	&lt;h1&gt;For The Sake Of Example: The Trial of Private Benjamin Hart&lt;/h1&gt;&#xD;
&lt;/div&gt;</HtmlDescription><ImageUrl>49ff9f08-4122-401d-b8f1-9ea0dfa09cc0.jpg</ImageUrl><IsOnSale>true</IsOnSale><Name>For The Sake Of Example</Name><RelatedEvents/><RelatedStockItems/><ThumbnailUrl>a110e122-5766-4693-909e-2e2fc87fca62.jpg</ThumbnailUrl></Event><Event id="18477"><Attribute><Name>Account Code</Name><Value>41011 - 966</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Comedy</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Confirmation Text</Name><Value>REMEMBER! This event is NOT at the main theatre. If you need additional directions, please contact a Ticket Sales Assistant on 01473 295900.  </Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Dance</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Different</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Drama</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>EventInfo</Name><Value>Presented by The New Wolsey Young Company</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Family</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Felixstowe Book Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Food</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Friends</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Music</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Musical</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Open Season</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Opera</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Other Venues</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Panto</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Poetry</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Pulse Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Sales Type</Name><Value>NWT - Own Sales</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Season</Name><Value>14 Autumn</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>VAT code for Accounts</Name><Value>VAT 3 (Exempt)</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Venue</Name><Value>New Wolsey Studio, St Georges Street, Ipswich, IP1 3NF</Value></Attribute><Description>By / Paul Webb  &#xD;
Directed by / Rob Salmon&#xD;
&#xD;
The 12th Century: The Archbishop of Canterbury is dead and England is crying out for the murderers' blood. The four knights guilty of the crime are being hunted, their lives and careers are ruined and one of them has a bloody awful toothache...&#xD;
&#xD;
Set over the following year, Four Nights in Knaresborough attempts to answer the question of what happened after these men committed "the worst career move in history".&#xD;
&#xD;
Funny, violent, touching and intelligent; join Brito, Traci, Morville and Fitz as they fight, freeze and fornicate through the worst year of their lives.&#xD;
&#xD;
Strong language and graphic content make this play suitable for ages 14 and over.</Description><Duration>0</Duration><HtmlDescription>&lt;div id&gt;&#xD;

&#xD;
A tribute to the men and women who battled for victory. The stories of Military heroes &amp; Munitions Workers, of Zeppelin Raids &amp; Rationing, and the vital work done by Ipswich Manufacturers.&#xD;
&#xD;
NOTE: Please add your choice of ticket to A Farewell To Arms to the basket after booking your walk place. If you wish to upgrade to a Premium seat, the total cost will be £25.&#xD;
&#xD;
This season, the New Wolsey Theatre will be taking part in a global commemoration to remember the lives of those who lived, fought and died in the First World War. &#xD;
&#xD;
IWM (Imperial War Museums) are leading the First World War Centenary Partnership, a network of cultural and educational organisations, and these events will be listed along with many others across the country.&#xD;

	&lt;h1&gt;Manpower&lt;/h1&gt;&#xD;
&lt;/div&gt;</HtmlDescription><ImageUrl>f2c7fefa-a5b2-4eaa-9845-6e74b73873bd.jpg</ImageUrl><IsOnSale>true</IsOnSale><Name>Manpower</Name><RelatedEvents/><RelatedStockItems/><ThumbnailUrl>cc78c8de-7c1a-4687-a5ac-0c4a363c9b00.jpg</ThumbnailUrl></Event><Event id="17675"><Attribute><Name>Account Code</Name><Value>41011 - 204</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Comedy</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Dance</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Different</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Drama</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>EventInfo</Name><Value>Presented by The New Wolsey Theatre</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Family</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Felixstowe Book Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Food</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Friends</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Music</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Musical</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Open Season</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Opera</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Panto</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Poetry</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Pulse Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Sales Type</Name><Value>NWT - Own Sales</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Season</Name><Value>14 Autumn</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>VAT code for Accounts</Name><Value>VAT 3 (Exempt)</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Venue</Name><Value>New Wolsey Theatre, Civic Drive, Ipswich, IP1 2AS</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Confirmation Text</Name><Value/></Attribute><Description>Book and Lyrics by / Peter Rowe&#xD;
Music by / Ben Goddard&#xD;
&#xD;
“Wherever we are in 25 years, we'll come back and create the B side”&#xD;
&#xD;
Twenty-five years ago a group of friends celebrated the end of their university careers with a wild week in a barn half-way up a mountain in West Wales. A week of madness, mayhem and music, recorded on a C90 cassette and buried in a biscuit tin at the top of a hill with a pledge – “Wherever we are in twenty-five years’ time we’ll come back here on Midsummer’s Eve and create the B side”.&#xD;
&#xD;
And now we see those old friends return, a little rounder, a bit more rueful but with their passion for life, love and music still smouldering inside. &#xD;
&#xD;
As the biscuit tin gives up its secrets, old passions catch fire, past resentments return and the songs begin to fly. Will this reunion change their lives? Will the album ever be finished? And what on earth can they play that cassette on?&#xD;
&#xD;
This brand new musical is a celebration of friendship, survival and the power of song, written especially for a company of multi-skilled actor-musicians in the New Wolsey house style; with music like the ballads of Joni Mitchell and the summer feel good fun of Mumford and Sons.&#xD;
&#xD;
Autumn 4 or 8 Show Evening Package&#xD;
&#xD;
Book 4 or more shows in the same band and save up to £50&#xD;
Book 8 or more shows in the same band and save up to £100&#xD;
&#xD;
Book all your tickets in the same price band (Premium or Band A) for your choice of Midsummer Songs, Private Peaceful, The Trials Of Oscar Wilde, Champions Of Magic, The Kings Of Cool, Eric And Little Ern, Songbird: The Music Of Eva Cassidy, Mugenkyo Taiko Drummers, Three Men In A Boat, The Magnificent Music Hall, Mud Morganfield, A Farewell To Arms and This Is My Family. The discount will automatically be applied. For further details visit www.wolseytheatre.co.uk/eveningpackages</Description><Duration>130</Duration><HtmlDescription>&lt;div id&gt;&#xD;
	&lt;h1&gt;Midsummer Songs&lt;/h1&gt;&#xD;
&lt;/div&gt;</HtmlDescription><ImageUrl>652a2b2f-faaa-48e8-a2db-838f9b49d5a7.jpg</ImageUrl><IsOnSale>true</IsOnSale><Name>Midsummer Songs</Name><RelatedEvents><Event id="19081"/><Event id="19475"/></RelatedEvents><RelatedStockItems/><ThumbnailUrl>29c48a2d-6689-437d-8162-4ee6cba9dfc9.jpg</ThumbnailUrl></Event><Event id="19077"><Attribute><Name>Account Code</Name><Value>41011 - J77</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Comedy</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Dance</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Different</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Drama</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>EventInfo</Name><Value>Presented by Stephen Foster Promotions</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Family</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Felixstowe Book Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Food</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Friends</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Music</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Musical</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Open Season</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Opera</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Panto</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Poetry</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Pulse Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Sales Type</Name><Value>NWT - Own Sales</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Season</Name><Value>14 Autumn</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>VAT code for Accounts</Name><Value>VAT 3 (Exempt)</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Venue</Name><Value>New Wolsey Theatre, Civic Drive, Ipswich, IP1 2AS</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Confirmation Text</Name><Value/></Attribute><Description>The eldest son of blues legend Muddy Waters comes to Ipswich for the biggest blues night the town has seen for many a year. Larry Mud Morganfield is the proud heir of the King of Chicago Blues with a big and powerful voice and the showmanship to go with it. He has shared stages throughout the world with many of his father’s fellow superstars like Buddy Guy and Pinetop Perkins. Mud has also appeared on Jools Holland’s Later TV show. &#xD;
&#xD;
For his eagerly awaited Suffolk debut he will be joined by an all-star group which includes Big Town Playboy Ian Jennings and harmonica player Steve Weston who appears on the best-selling album Going Back Home by Wilko Johnson and Roger Daltrey. Mud Morganfield’s show is the ultimate blues experience. &#xD;
&#xD;
BONFIRE NIGHT&#xD;
BBQ on the terrace for £2.50 per person. Must be booked with your tickets. You'll be given the option during the booking process. Limited availability&#xD;

&#xD;

	&lt;h1&gt;Pop&lt;/h1&gt;&#xD;

	&lt;h1&gt;Pre Show Meal (to 15th November)&lt;/h1&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;h2&gt;Make note of your meal choice before choosing date &amp; time&lt;/h2&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;OPTION 1&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;Beef &amp; Vegetables in a Black Bean Sauce with Rice and Lemon &amp; Stem Ginger Cheesecake&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;OPTION 2&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;Beef &amp; Vegetables in a Black Bean Sauce with Rice and Blackberry &amp; Apple Pie&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;OPTION 3&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;Chicken with Tarragon Cream &amp; Green Bean Rice and Lemon &amp; Stem Ginger Cheesecake&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;OPTION 4&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;Chicken with Tarragon Cream &amp; Green Bean Rice and Blackberry &amp; Apple Pie&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;OPTION 5&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;Thai Green Curry &amp; Rice (V) &amp; Lemon and Stem Ginger Cheesecake&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;OPTION 6&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;Thai Green Curry &amp; Rice (V) and Blackberry &amp; Apple Pie&#xD;

	&lt;h1&gt;Pre Show Menu June &amp; July&lt;/h1&gt;&lt;h2&gt;Open Season 2014&lt;/h2&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;This season you can choose a two course option from a set menu when you book your tickets. Set menu bookings do not include your tickets so remember to book those too! &lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;MAINS	 &lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;Paprika Chicken with Buttery New Potatoes &lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;Spaghetti Meatballs Vegetable Curry with Rice &lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;DESSERTS &lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;Rocky Road Sundae &lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;Traditional Eton Mess &lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;CHOOSE A SIDE DISH ON THE DAY &lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;Coleslaw &lt;span class="ItalicText"&gt; Wedges &lt;/span&gt; Salad &lt;span class="ItalicText"&gt; Garlic Bread &lt;/span&gt; Fine Green Beans &lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;OPTION 1	Paprika Chicken &lt;span class="ItalicText"&gt; Rocky Road Sundae &lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;OPTION 2	Paprika Chicken &lt;/span&gt; Traditional Eton Mess &lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;OPTION 3	Spaghetti Meatballs &lt;span class="ItalicText"&gt; Rocky Road Sundae &lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;OPTION 4	Spaghetti Meatballs &lt;/span&gt; Traditional Eton Mess &lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;OPTION 5	Vegetable Curry with Rice &lt;span class="ItalicText"&gt; Rocky Road Sundae &lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;OPTION 6	Vegetable Curry with Rice &lt;/span&gt; Traditional Eton Mess&#xD;
&lt;/div&gt;</HtmlDescription><ImageUrl>49382b1c-a288-4790-b89a-ccab382ae42e.jpg</ImageUrl><IsOnSale>true</IsOnSale><Name>Pre Show Menu (June &amp; July)</Name><RelatedEvents/><RelatedStockItems/><ThumbnailUrl>c8362e78-14f1-45f5-b470-3aee220e5712.jpg</ThumbnailUrl></Event><Event id="17878"><Attribute><Name>Account Code</Name><Value>41011 - J59</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Children</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Comedy</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Dance</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Different</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Drama</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>EventInfo</Name><Value>Presented by Scamp Theatre</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Family</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Food</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Friends</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Music</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Musical</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>New Wolsey Production</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>New Writing</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Open Season</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Opera</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Other Venues</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Panto</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Poetry</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Pulse Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Sales Type</Name><Value>NWT - Own Sales</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Season</Name><Value>14 Autumn</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>VAT code for Accounts</Name><Value>VAT 3 (Exempt)</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Venue</Name><Value>New Wolsey Theatre, Civic Drive, Ipswich, IP1 2AS</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Youth Theatre</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Confirmation Text</Name><Value/></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Felixstowe Book Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Description>By / Michael Morpurgo (Author of War Horse)&#xD;
Adapted &amp; Directed by /  Simon Reade&#xD;
&#xD;
Private Peaceful relives the life of Private Tommo Peaceful, a young First World War soldier awaiting the firing squad at dawn.&#xD;
During the night he looks back at his short but joyful past growing up in rural Devon; his exciting first days at school; the accident in the forest that killed his father; his adventures with Molly, the love of his life; and the battles and injustices of war that brought him to the front line. &#xD;
&#xD;
Winner of the Blue Peter Book of the Year, Private Peaceful is by third Children’s Laureate, Michael Morpurgo. His inspiration came from a visit to Ypres where he was shocked to discover how many young soldiers were court-martialled and shot for cowardice during the First World War. &#xD;
&#xD;
‘As moving as the poetry of Wilfred Owen and as painfully &#xD;
memorable as white-hot shrapnel…’ - ***** The Sunday Herald&#xD;
&#xD;
Suitable for ages 8+&#xD;
&#xD;
Autumn 4 or 8 Show Evening Package&#xD;
&#xD;
Book 4 or more shows in the same band and save up to £50&#xD;
Book 8 or more shows in the same band and save up to £100&#xD;
&#xD;
Book all your tickets in the same price band (Premium or Band A) for your choice of Midsummer Songs, Private Peaceful, The Trials Of Oscar Wilde, Champions Of Magic, The Kings Of Cool, Eric And Little Ern, Songbird: The Music Of Eva Cassidy, Mugenkyo Taiko Drummers, Three Men In A Boat, The Magnificent Music Hall, Mud Morganfield, A Farewell To Arms and This Is My Family. The discount will automatically be applied. For further details visit www.wolseytheatre.co.uk/eveningpackages&#xD;
</Description><Duration>120</Duration><HtmlDescription>&lt;div id&gt;&#xD;
	&lt;h1&gt;Private Peaceful&lt;/h1&gt;&#xD;
&lt;/div&gt;</HtmlDescription><ImageUrl>d7427590-63ad-4182-8a02-96591046a451.jpg</ImageUrl><IsOnSale>true</IsOnSale><Name>Private Peaceful</Name><RelatedEvents><Event id="19475"/><Event id="19477"/><Event id="19675"/></RelatedEvents><RelatedStockItems/><ThumbnailUrl>876a6eee-f04d-4ed2-8b4a-b57a92ee8511.jpg</ThumbnailUrl></Event><Event id="18476"><Attribute><Name>Account Code</Name><Value>41011 - J63</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Children</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Comedy</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Dance</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Different</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Drama</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>EventInfo</Name><Value>Presented by Custom/Practice &amp; The Corn Exchange, Newbury</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Family</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Felixstowe Book Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Food</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Friends</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Music</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Musical</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>New Wolsey Production</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>New Writing</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Open Season</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Opera</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Other Venues</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Panto</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Poetry</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Pulse Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Sales Type</Name><Value>NWT - Own Sales</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Season</Name><Value>14 Autumn</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>VAT code for Accounts</Name><Value>VAT 3 (Exempt)</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Venue</Name><Value>New Wolsey Theatre, Civic Drive, Ipswich, IP1 2AS</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Youth Theatre</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Confirmation Text</Name><Value/></Attribute><Description>Directed by Rae Mcken (Artistic Director, Custom/Practice), in collaboration with choreographer Kenrick ‘H20’ Sandy and composer Michael ‘Mikey J’ Asante, from the Olivier award winning hip-hop dance company, Boy Blue.&#xD;
&#xD;
Set amongst the princes and nobles of Verona, this dynamic new production combines the purity and beauty of Shakespeare’s original text with entrancing contemporary street dance. &#xD;
&#xD;
Caught between the long-running and bitter feud of their families, the Montagues and the Capulets, the star-crossed lovers must fight against the odds in this much-loved and powerful tale of forbidden romance, jealousy and betrayal.&#xD;
&#xD;
This dazzling and innovative version of the unforgettable classic is a must see for newcomers to Shakespeare and regular theatregoers alike.&#xD;
&#xD;
‘Energetic and imaginative… and a generous sprinkling of faerie dust’ - **** Metro on A Midsummer Night’s Dream&#xD;
&#xD;
‘Quality Shakespeare at its most accessible’ - The Stage on Twelfth Night&#xD;
&#xD;
‘The kind of energy and enthusiasm that Shakespeare thrives upon’ - Time Out on A Midsummer Night’s Dream</Description><Duration>125</Duration><HtmlDescription>&lt;div id&gt;&#xD;

Supported by a brilliant on-stage live band, video footage and classic Eva Cassidy arrangements of some of the best songs of the late 20th century, Sarah-Jane Buckley presents a show which has already been hailed as...“a tour de force performance that is nothing short of phenomenal”.  &#xD;

	&lt;h1&gt;Sounds Familiar In Concert 2014&lt;/h1&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;Presented by the Ipswich Operatic &amp; Dramatic Society.&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/span&gt;PLEASE NOTE: The New Wolsey Theatre is acting as a ticketing agency for this event. Please check the venue and event details carefully.&#xD;
&lt;/div&gt;</HtmlDescription><ImageUrl>e904f741-b97a-4252-a49b-3fbcfc44f097.jpg</ImageUrl><IsOnSale>true</IsOnSale><Name>Sounds Familiar In Concert 2014</Name><RelatedEvents/><RelatedStockItems/><ThumbnailUrl>66488abb-ef8f-48f0-ba47-16dac01461c2.jpg</ThumbnailUrl></Event><Event id="19279"><Attribute><Name>Account Code</Name><Value>37211 960</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Children</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Comedy</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Confirmation Text</Name><Value> 	Please note that all children must be acompanied by an adult.</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Dance</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Different</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Drama</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>EventInfo</Name><Value>Meet at Ticket Desk</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Family</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Felixstowe Book Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Food</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Friends</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Music</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Musical</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>New Wolsey Production</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>New Writing</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Open Season</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Opera</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Other Venues</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Panto</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Poetry</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Pulse Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Sales Type</Name><Value>NWT - &#xD;
In the carpark of a suburban DIY superstore, Andy looks up. Something is falling out of the sky. A man crash-lands on the ground in front of him. &#xD;
&#xD;
The premiere of a brand new show by Analogue (Beachy Head, 2401 Objects).&#xD;
&#xD;
Commissioned by New Wolsey Theatre. Supported by Creative Scotland, Arts Council England and British Council. Developed at Traverse Theatre and Shoreditch Town Hall. &#xD;

‘The bright young things of British Theatre’ - The Observer</Description><Duration>70</Duration><HtmlDescription>&lt;div id&gt;&#xD;
	&lt;h1&gt;Stowaway&lt;/h1&gt;&#xD;

Own Sales</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Season</Name><Value>14 Autumn</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>VAT code for Accounts</Name><Value>VAT 3 (Exempt)</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Venue</Name><Value>New Wolsey Theatre, Civic Drive, Ipswich, IP1 2AS</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Youth Theatre</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Confirmation Text</Name><Value/></Attribute><Description>The Hogwallops are a family who constantly bicker, scheme and play practical jokes! They live in a chaotic crazy home that is more like an adventure playground where the ordinary always becomes extraordinary. &#xD;
&#xD;
Every day activities are extreme, with simple tasks such as bedtime and teeth brushing needing a bungee and high level jet-spray. Dressing is a game of flying aerial wardrobe antics, and meal times are a nerve-wracking display of juggling food and crockery. With lots of laughs and acrobatic stunts that will leave the whole family entertained.&#xD;
&#xD;
For all the family!</Description><Duration>0</Duration><HtmlDescription>&lt;div id&gt;&#xD;
	&lt;h1&gt;The Hogswallops&lt;/h1&gt;&#xD;
&lt;/div&gt;</HtmlDescription><ImageUrl>3a89fcca-0fd1-422e-82f6-78973ebca022.jpg</ImageUrl><IsOnSale>true</IsOnSale><Name>The Hogwallops</Name><RelatedEvents><Event id="19675"/></RelatedEvents><RelatedStockItems/><ThumbnailUrl>d866c769-5456-4a00-847a-9e41f2640ec2.jpg</ThumbnailUrl></Event><Event id="18876"><Attribute><Name>Account Code</Name><Value>41101 - J68</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Comedy</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Dance</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Different</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Drama</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>EventInfo</Name><Value>Presented by Baluji Shrivastav</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Family</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Felixstowe Book Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Food</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Friends</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Music</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Musical</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Open Season</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Opera</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Panto</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Poetry</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Pulse Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Sales Type</Name><Value>NWT - Own Sales</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Season</Name><Value>14 Autumn</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>VAT code for Accounts</Name><Value>VAT 3 (Exempt)</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Venue</Name><Value>New Wolsey Theatre, Civic Drive, Ipswich, IP1 2AS</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Confirmation Text</Name><Value/></Attribute><Description>Indian maestro and Musical Director Baluji Shrivastav also known as “sitarist to the stars”, having played with George Harrison, recorded for Boy George, Annie Lennox, Massive Attack, Future Sound of London, Shakira and the Doves (to name a few!) has brought together incredible musicians from around the world who are blind or partially sighted.&#xD;
&#xD;
Their uplifting music moves between songs from Iran, Lebanon, Afghanistan, India, Nigeria, to soulful Gospel and Blues to sublime Indian Ragas and Western Classical compositions. Driven by the intensity of an inner vision they celebrate the power of music to transform lives.&#xD;
&#xD;
Working in partnership with Sensing Change, with volunteers from the My Guide Scheme.</Description><Duration>130</Duration><HtmlDescription>&lt;div id&gt;&#xD;
	&lt;h1&gt;The Inner Vision Orchestra&lt;/h1&gt;&#xD;
&lt;/div&gt;</HtmlDescription><ImageUrl>e86c72c2-94be-4a9c-8196-ca23805014a9.jpg</ImageUrl><IsOnSale>true</IsOnSale><Name>The Inner Vision Orchestra</Name><RelatedEvents><Event id="19675"/></RelatedEvents><RelatedStockItems/><ThumbnailUrl>0d0900a9-dd06-42eb-b71b-53fa8540235c.jpg</ThumbnailUrl></Event><Event id="18875"><Attribute><Name>Account Code</Name><Value>41011 - J65</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Children</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Comedy</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Confirmation Text</Name><Value>Please note that this performance is at the earlier start time of 7.00pm.</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Dance</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Different</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Drama</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>EventInfo</Name><Value>With Matthew Ford And His Band</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Family</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Felixstowe Book Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Food</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Friends</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Music</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Musical</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>New Wolsey Production</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>New Writing</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Open Season</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Opera</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Other Venues</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Panto</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Poetry</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Pulse Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Sales Type</Name><Value>NWT - Own Sales</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Season</Name><Value>14 Autumn</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>VAT code for Accounts</Name><Value>VAT 3 (Exempt)</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Venue</Name><Value>New Wolsey Theatre, Civic Drive, Ipswich, IP1 2AS</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Youth Theatre</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Description>With Matthew Ford And His Band&#xD;
&#xD;
A celebration of the coolest crooners. The hits of Frank Sinatra, Tony Bennett, Michael Buble, Bobby Darin, Andy Williams and many more…&#xD;
&#xD;
Award–winning vocalist Matt Ford is widely regarded as the finest big band singer in the UK, broadcasting frequently with the BBC Big Band and The John Wilson Orchestra. Matt works regularly with acclaimed conductor John Wilson, performing at the 2011 BBC Proms in ‘Hooray For Hollywood‘ and subsequently touring the UK with the John Wilson Orchestra, something he repeated in November 2013. Last year Matt returned to the Royal Albert Hall for his second BBC Proms appearance (Hollywood Rhapsody), and made his US debut, performing in Hollywood with Seth Macfarlane. The Kings Of Cool features Matt’s own stunning nine piece band made up of the finest musicians in the UK.&#xD;
&#xD;
If you are a fan of cool swinging standards, The Great American Songbook, and the music of The Rat Pack, then this is the show for you.&#xD;
&#xD;
Autumn 4 or 8 Show Evening Package&#xD;
&#xD;
Book 4 or more shows in the same band and save up to £50&#xD;
Book 8 or more shows in the same band and save up to £100&#xD;
&#xD;
Book all your tickets in the same price band (Premium or Band A) for your choice of Midsummer Songs, Private Peaceful, The Trials Of Oscar Wilde, Champions Of Magic, The Kings Of Cool, Eric And Little Ern, Songbird: The Music Of Eva Cassidy, Mugenkyo Taiko Drummers, Three Men In A Boat, The Magnificent Music Hall, Mud Morganfield, A Farewell To Arms and This Is My Family. The discount will automatically be applied. For further details visit www.wolseytheatre.co.uk/eveningpackages</Description><Duration>125</Duration><HtmlDescription>&lt;div id&gt;&#xD;
	&lt;h1&gt;The Kings Of Cool&lt;/h1&gt;&#xD;
&lt;/div&gt;</HtmlDescription><ImageUrl>2982f5b8-7fbd-40ce-bd45-95bbf8bb5907.jpg</ImageUrl><IsOnSale>true</IsOnSale><Name>The Kings Of Cool</Name><RelatedEvents><Event id="19675"/></RelatedEvents><RelatedStockItems/><ThumbnailUrl>36686759-fb9c-42ce-8846-fd34d53b9fbe.jpg</ThumbnailUrl></Event><Event id="19076"><Attribute><Name>Account Code</Name><Value>41011 - 206</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Comedy</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Dance</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Different</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Drama</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>EventInfo</Name><Value>Presented by GETINTHEBACKOFTHEVAN</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Family</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Felixstowe Book Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Food</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Friends</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Music</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Musical</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Open Season</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Opera</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Panto</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Poetry</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Pulse Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Sales Type</Name><Value>NWT - Own Sales</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Season</Name><Value>14 Autumn</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>VAT code for Accounts</Name><Value>VAT 3 (Exempt)</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Venue</Name><Value>New Wolsey Theatre, Civic Drive, Ipswich, IP1 2AS</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Confirmation Text</Name><Value/></Attribute><Description>GETINTHEBACKOFTHEVAN present The Live Art Community Musical&#xD;
&#xD;
The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas&#xD;
&#xD;
Book by Larry L. King and Peter Masterson&#xD;
Music and Lyrics by Carol Hall&#xD;
&#xD;
GETINTHEBACKOFTHEVAN take a smash-hit musical and smash it!&#xD;
&#xD;
This Live Art Community Musical charges headlong into a bare-knuckle fight with virtuosity, legitimacy and taboo. A ‘misfit’ cast skips its way through a toe-tappingly problematic landscape of stereotype - the kind we convince ourselves has been wiped clean off the map by now.&#xD;
&#xD;
The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas sees brothel madam Miss Mona run out of town by a crusading do-gooder celebrity. What will her girls do? Will Mona and the Sheriff re-light their spark? Will the local football team’s annual orgy get busted and leave everyone with their pants down? Are GETINTHEBACKOFTHEVAN just making a pointless song and dance? &#xD;
&#xD;
Stuffed with cameos and interventions, GETINTHEBACKOFTHEVAN's version of The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas explores exertion, desire, cliché, the epic and will be unlike any musical you have ever seen. &#xD;
&#xD;
Look out for the open call for your chance to be involved! No experience necessary.  Information will be announced on getinthebackofthevan.com. &#xD;
&#xD;
GETINTHEBACKOFTHEVAN is a performance company based in Essex and London making work at the crossroads between theatre, live art, cabaret and stand-up. They are particularly interested in humour, endurance, glory and the banal. The company is an Artsadmin Associate Artist and an associate company at both Colchester Arts Centre and Roehampton University.&#xD;
&#xD;
A SPILL Commission, presented in partnership with the New Wolsey Theatre.&#xD;
&#xD;
Co-produced by Cambridge Junction, ICIA University of Bath, Colchester Arts Centre, Norwich Arts Centre and Roehampton University. With additional support from the National Theatre Studio, BAC, Live at LICA, Nuffield Theatre (Southampton), The Point (Eastleigh).&#xD;
&#xD;
By special arrangement with Samuel French Limited.&#xD;
</Description><Duration>0</Duration><HtmlDescription>&lt;div id&gt;&#xD;

They're back, by popular demand! &#xD;
&#xD;
This glittering galaxy of stars from BBC TV's The Good Old Days  will once again delight and entertain with songs, dance, magic and laughter portraying with great wit and warmth this truly golden era of Victorian Music Hall.&#xD;
&#xD;
Carefree, cheerful and uniquely British. Unmissable!&#xD;

	&lt;h1&gt;The Magnificent Music Hall&lt;/h1&gt;&#xD;

If you need additional directions, please contact a Ticket Sales Assistant on 01473 295900.  </Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Dance</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Different</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Drama</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>EventInfo</Name><Value>Presented by The Bright Shadow</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Family</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Felixstowe Book Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Food</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Friends</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Music</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Musical</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Open Season</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Opera</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Other Venues</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Panto</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Poetry</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Pulse Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Sales Type</Name><Value>NWT - Own Sales</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Season</Name><Value>14 Autumn</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>VAT code for Accounts</Name><Value>VAT 3 (Exempt)</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Venue</Name><Value>New Wolsey Studio, St Georges Street, Ipswich, IP1 3NF</Value></Attribute><Description>Mr Pillowmaker comes from a long line of Pillow Makers. Throughout all time they have used magical Stuff to fill their super soft, super plumpy pillows for beds and heads across the land. &#xD;
&#xD;
One day, Mr Pillowmaker finds that for the first time EVER, his Stuff Box is empty and now he doesn't have anything to stuff his pillows with!&#xD;
&#xD;
Join Mr Pillowmaker inside Pillow Cottage and take part in his adventure to discover how to make his magical Stuff come back again. &#xD;
&#xD;
For ages 1 to 5.</Description><Duration>60</Duration><HtmlDescription>&lt;div id&gt;&#xD;
	&lt;h1&gt;The Pillow Maker&lt;/h1&gt;&#xD;

&lt;/div&gt;</HtmlDescription><ImageUrl>2d98a9d9-0972-489d-8afa-cb2418d2842e.jpg</ImageUrl><IsOnSale>true</IsOnSale><Name>The Tinder Box</Name><RelatedEvents/><RelatedStockItems/><ThumbnailUrl>b37ad0cc-441c-4b63-b9c0-1f4e1da33b68.jpg</ThumbnailUrl></Event><Event id="18075"><Attribute><Name>Account Code</Name><Value>41011 - Own Sales</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Season</Name><Value>14 Autumn</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>VAT code for Accounts</Name><Value>VAT 3 (Exempt)</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Venue</Name><Value>New Wolsey Theatre, Civic Drive, Ipswich, IP1 2AS</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Youth Theatre</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Confirmation Text</Name><Value/></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Felixstowe Book Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Description>European Arts Company returns with a dramatisation of the libel and criminal trials of Oscar Wilde at the Old Bailey in 1895.&#xD;
Thursday 14 February 1895 was the triumphant opening night of The Importance of Being Earnest and the zenith of Wilde’s career. Less than 100 days later, he found himself a common prisoner sentenced to two years hard labour.&#xD;
&#xD;
So what happened during the trials and what did Wilde say? Was he persecuted or the author of his own downfall? Using the original words spoken in court, we can feel what it was like to be in the company of a flawed genius - as this less than ideal husband was suddenly reduced to a man of no importance.&#xD;
&#xD;

&#xD;
Words and music by / Tim Firth&#xD;
&#xD;
‘This is my family.’ That was the competition. All Nicky had to do was describe her family and she could win a dream holiday. Ok, so she lied through her teeth and made them all sound perfect, but who cares!?  She won! She could take them to Rio! To Florida! Acapulco!&#xD;
Instead, fourteen year-old Nicky Perry chooses pretty much the last holiday her family were expecting…&#xD;
&#xD;
This fast-moving, laugh-out-loud and hugely moving new musical from the writer of Calendar Girls goes to the heart of the question: what exactly is the point of &#xD;
family in the modern age? &#xD;
&#xD;
‘sweet as a nut, funny, truthful, glorying in grumpy family love’ - The Times&#xD;

Adapted by &amp; Directed by / Craig Gilbert &#xD;
Designed by / Victoria Spearing &#xD;
Lighting by / Alan Valentine &#xD;
&#xD;
Following a sell-out hit tour in 2012, Craig Gilbert’s ingenious, acclaimed adaption of Jerome K Jerome’s classic tale of boating misadventure returns to the UK stage this autumn armed with more singing, wilder adventures and sporting even brighter blazers. &#xD;
&#xD;
Originally intended as a guide to boating on the Thames, Jerome’s ripping yarn of youthful friendship, mischief and folly celebrates the very essence of Britishness inspiring many of our comic legends from Morecambe and Wise to Monty Python. &#xD;
&#xD;
Original Theatre Company take this classic tale of British misadventure and folly by the scruff of the neck. Equipped with a working pub, live piano accompaniment, some ale, music hall singing, a dog and a feast of physical comedy, settle yourself in for a night out to remember. &#xD;
&#xD;

	&lt;h1&gt;Three Men In A Boat&lt;/h1&gt;&#xD;
&lt;/div&gt;</HtmlDescription><ImageUrl>b103183a-fcfd-48f4-b5ce-27d3f2915ae0.jpg</ImageUrl><IsOnSale>true</IsOnSale><Name>Three Men In A Boat</Name><RelatedEvents><Event id="19675"/></RelatedEvents><RelatedStockItems/><ThumbnailUrl>8474fb97-c446-4789-8b95-063b313b473a.jpg</ThumbnailUrl></Event><Event id="19679"><Attribute><Name>Account Code</Name><Value>41011 J81 </Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Comedy</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Dance</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Different</Name><Value>1</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Drama</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>EventInfo</Name><Value>Meet at Ticket Desk</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Family</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Felixstowe Book Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Food</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Friends</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Music</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Musical</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Open Season</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Opera</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Panto</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Poetry</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Pulse Festival</Name><Value>0</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Sales Type</Name><Value>NWT - Own Sales</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Season</Name><Value>14 Autumn</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>VAT code for Accounts</Name><Value>VAT 3 (Exempt)</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Venue</Name><Value>New Wolsey Theatre, Civic Drive, Ipswich, IP1 2AS</Value></Attribute><Attribute><Name>Confirmation Text</Name><Value/></Attribute><Description>The Wounding of Private Charles Ingleton.&#xD;
&#xD;
A talk presented by Dr John Greenacre, First World War Centenary Project Coordinator from University Campus Suffolk.&#xD;
&#xD;
Private Charles Ingleton was an Australian infantryman wounded on the Western Front in 1916. His evacuation took him from a trench in French Flanders to a bed in the East Suffolk and Ipswich Hospital. John Greenacre examines the treatment of Charles Ingleton and the effectiveness of British Army medical services during the First World War.&#xD;
&#xD;
This season, the New Wolsey Theatre will be taking part in a global commemoration to remember the lives of those who lived, fought and died in the First World War. &#xD;
&#xD;
IWM (Imperial War Museums) are leading the First World War Centenary Partnership, a network of cultural and educational organisations, and these events will be listed along with many others across the country.&#xD;
&#xD;
Find out more at www.1914.org</Description><Duration>0</Duration><HtmlDescription>&lt;div id&gt;&#xD;

&#xD;
"No one knows why that fat bird in year 8 killed herself, but she got everyone a day off school! So they're having a party for her? - it's gonna be epic!"&#xD;
&#xD;
For best friends Jade and Paris, the lead up to the big night where everyone is logging in, updating and messaging, brings discoveries that casual viral actions have serious real-life consequences.&#xD;
&#xD;
The New Wolsey Theatre, Birmingham Repertory Theatre and Liverpool Everyman and Playhouse are in partnership to create new productions using young theatre makers. They will become the writers, devisors, actors and producers of theatre for young people by young people. Follow their journey at facebook.com/youthemakers and twitter @YouTheMakers</Description><Duration>0</Duration><HtmlDescription>&lt;div id&gt;&#xD;

For this event no tickets will be dispatched prior, please take your booking confirmation or order number to the venue on the night to collect your tickets.</Description><Duration>0</Duration><HtmlDescription>&lt;div id&gt;&#xD;
